The FlexResponse API is used to build FlexResponse plugins.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse  
com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.action
This package defines the main classes needed to construct an IncidentResponseAction.
com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.configuration
This package has classes related to the configuration of a plugin.
com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.discover
Discover data is described by the interfaces in this package.
com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.incident
This package provides information about the incident for which a plugin action is being invoked.
com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.policy
This package provides information about the policy that was violated to cause the incident.

The FlexResponse API is used to build FlexResponse plugins. A FlexResponse plugin can be installed into the Symantec DLP system and then used to respond to incidents.

For example, you may want to be able to "unquarantine" files that have been mistakenly quarantined. Using this API, you can write a plugin that, when its action is invoked, can move the file back to its original location.

To get started, you will want to write a Plugin and an IncidentResponseAction.

A Plugin acts as a factory, creating IncidentResponseAction instances as needed.

An IncidentResponseAction has an execute method that is called whenever a user runs your plugin against a specific incident.

For a more in-depth overview of the FlexResponse API and how to use it, please see the FlexResponse SDK documentation that is provided with the FlexResponse SDK.
